title: An era of distrust emerges between the US and its Western allies
subhead: Donald Trump's suggestion that the US could seize Greenland by force has exposed the strategic isolation his administration has chosen, in disregard for the country's commitments. Even though the Republican president abandoned the idea at Davos, the damage to US credibility is substantial.

title: Greenland and Denmark exercise caution, set out 'red lines' after Trump's reversal
The RN's unspoken attraction to MAGA – and gradual ideological alignment
Robert Malley, former American diplomat: 'Few truly care about the future of the Iranian people'
subhead: As calls resound for a US intervention against the regime in Tehran, Malley, a former adviser to presidents Barack Obama and Joe Biden, warns that any such action could have disastrous consequences.

title: TikTok establishes joint venture to end US ban threat
subhead: The majority American-owned joint venture will serve more than 200 million users and 7.5 million businesses, with plans to implement stricter safeguards for data protection.

title: French say they love art, but rarely visit exhibitions
subhead: An Ipsos-BVA survey for Beaux Arts Magazine, released on Thursday, reveals the public's taste for contemporary art but a limited knowledge of living artists.

title: Syria's Al-Hol prison has become a mini-caliphate for IS
subhead: Since Kurdish guards withdrew from the Al-Hol detention camp, where several thousand jihadists and their families are held, securing the camp has become a major challenge for the Syrian authorities.

How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data
subhead: Companies are offering law enforcement agencies the ability to track smartphone users through advertising data gathered on their devices. Le Monde attended confidential presentations of these new surveillance tools to learn more.

title: Who are Greenlanders and what do they really want?
subhead: Greenland, which is bigger than France, the UK, Germany and Spain combined, has a population of 57,000, most of whom are Inuit. They are also Danish citizens, a legacy of Denmark's colonization of the territory that began in the 18th century.
byline: Arthur Navet ,  Constance Derouin and  Sinead McCausland

title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
subhead: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.
